name: Atuin Server
description: Atuin Server provides a self-hosted sync service for the Atuin shell history tool. It stores your shell history in a PostgreSQL database and allows you to securely sync command history across all your devices with end-to-end encryption.

notes.text: PostgreSQL database is configured with username: atuin, password: atuin. Change these for production use.
The server listens on port 8888 by default and has open registration enabled.
To connect clients: atuin settings update sync_address http://<SERVER_IP>:8888
Users can register with: atuin register --username <USERNAME> --password <PASSWORD>
Server configuration file is located at: /etc/atuin/server.toml
For production use, consider setting up TLS by adding the [tls] section to the config file.
Restart the server after config changes with: systemctl restart atuin-server
For client usage instructions, visit: https://docs.atuin.sh/guide/basic-usage/
View all server logs with: journalctl -u atuin-server
Change PostgreSQL credentials with: sudo -u postgres psql -c "ALTER USER atuin WITH PASSWORD 'new_password';"
